Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hill-Cec4 (UCLL1, XXA, cecropin, natural AMPs;insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; Variant: H4)

Literature.Author: Van Moll L, De Smet J, Paas A, Tegtmeier D, Vilcinskas A, Cos P, Van Campenhout L.2022
Literature.Title: In Vitro Evaluation of Antimicrobial Peptides from the Black Soldier Fly (Hermetia Illucens) against a Selection of Human Pathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (93.33%) toHill-Cec3Activity: active against S-aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC >32-64 uM), E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 1-2 uM), P. aeruginos (MIC 1-2 uM).Discovery: this sequence has also been reported in a different paper where the C-terminal G is converted to C-terminal amidation in this sequence. Peptide H4 is active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 1.6 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 6.5 uM), A.baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 6.5 uM), P-aeruginosa CMCC10104(MIC >26 uM), V. parahaemolyticus ATCC17802 (MIC 3.2 uM), E-faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC >26 uM), B. subtilis BNCC109047 (MIC 1.6 uM), S-epidermidis ATCC35984 (MIC >26 uM), S-aureus ATCC6538 (MIC >26 uM), and C-albicans ATCC10231 (MIC > 26 uM) (Peng et al., 2023).
